intro: Psychotria lupulina subsp. rhodoleuca, commonly known as the red-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking red or purple leaves, which contrast with its small, white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
